bibliography.title: Gender in Danger? Evaluating Speech Translation Technology on the MuST-SHE Corpus
bibliography.authors: Luisa Bentivogli, Beatrice Savoldi, Matteo Negri et al.
bibliography.annotation: The candidate paper is relevant to the intellectual context of the topic. The paper discusses the challenges machines face when translating from languages without grammatical gender, like English, into gender-marked languages, which directly relates to the topic of how gender relates to language. The paper also explores how biases in training data, which often reflect the asymmetries of natural languages, can impact machine translation. This could provide insights into how gender biases are reflected in language and translation.
